fields.headline: Top 10 Africa bestsellers
fields.bodyText: In the wake of the Zimbabwean election, this week's chart comes from the Africa Book Centre. Interest in the debacle has pushed Martin Meredith's biography of Mugabe to the top slot. It has also boosted sales of Zimbabwe's Plunge , by Patrick Bond and Masimba Manyanya, and of the autobiography of the man Mugabe sidelined in the independence struggle, Joshua Nkomo. Chinua Achebe's classic, Things Fall Apart could well describe the situation in Zimbabwe, though it of course applies to Nigeria - a country whose current plight is brilliantly dissected by Karl Maier in This House Has Fallen . Another wonderful, if grisly book, Ludo de Witte's The Assassination of Lumumba - a genuinely revealing work - comes next. On a happier note, Rosamund Grant's Essential African Cookbook supplies recipes for groundnut chicken, lobster piri-piri and Nigerian Meat Stew. The latter is delicious, despite its blunt name. Top 10 Africa bestsellers 1 Mugabe: Power and Plunder in Zimbabwe by Martin Meredith (Public Affairs, £11.99) 2 This House Has Fallen by Karl Maier (Penguin, £9.99) 3 In Praise of Black Women: Ancient African Queens, Vol 1 by Simone Schwarz-Bart (University of Wisconsin Press, £45) 4 The Assassination of Lumumba by Ludo De Witte (Verso, £17) 5 Zimbabwe's Plunge: Exhausted Nationalism, Neoliberalism and the Struggle for Social Justice by Patrick Bond & Masimba Manyanya (Merlin Press, £14.95 ) 6 Against Global Apartheid: South Africa Meets the World Bank, IMF and International Finance by Patrick Bond (University of Cape Town Press, £14.99) 7 Things Fall Apart by Chinua Achebe (Heinemann, £6.50) 8 A History of Modern Ethiopia by Bahru Zewde (James Currey Publishers, £12.95) 9 Nkomo: The Story of My Life by Joshua Nkomo (Sapes, £13.99) 10 The Essential African Cookbookby Rosamund Grant (Anness Publishing, £6.95) Information supplied by the Africa Book Centre, 1st Floor, 38 King Street, London WC2 (020-7240 6649). www.africabookcentre.com
